alert.note: Alert for Estill; Jackson; Laurel; Lee; Owsley; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 27 at 9:20PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Laurel, northwestern Owsley, southwestern Estill, Jackson, southeastern Rockcastle and southwestern Lee Counties through 945 PM EST... At 919 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Victory, or 8 miles north of London, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... McKee, Carico, Jep Hill, Ardery, Atkinstown, Olin, Tyner, Annville, Deese, and Loam around 925 PM EST. New Zion, Privett, Zekes Point, Collingsworth, Lakes, Herd, Turkey Foot, Mummie, Macedonia, and Foxtown around 930 PM EST. Brazil, Arvel, Earnestville, Old Orchard, Wild Dog, Wind Cave, Green Hall, Elian, and Banford around 935 PM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Travellers Rest, Delvinta, Blanton Flats and Vincent. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 36 and 51. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Estill; Jackson; Laurel; Lee; Owsley; Rockcastle
